title: Gallery Talk: Discovering Art of the Andes
hero_caption: Portrait Vessel of a Ruler, 100 B.C./A.D. 500. Moche. North coast, Peru. Kate S. Buckingham Endowment.
short_description:
Ancient Andean art bears a number of characteristics that can be seen repeatedly over thousands of years. At the same time, within this canon, the many cultures that flourished throughout modern-day Peru, Bolivia, and Ecuador developed their own particular artistic styles that become readily recognizable once you know what to look for.

In this one-hour gallery talk, explore tradition and change in Andean art with associate curator Andrew J. Hamilton and develop a better appreciation for this impressive but little-known artistic tradition.
description:
Ancient Andean art bears a number of characteristics that can be seen repeatedly over thousands of years. At the same time, within this canon, the many cultures that flourished throughout modern-day Peru, Bolivia, and Ecuador developed their own particular artistic styles that become readily recognizable once you know what to look for.

In this one-hour gallery talk, explore tradition and change in Andean art with associate curator Andrew J. Hamilton and develop a better appreciation for this impressive but little-known artistic tradition.

Persons with disabilities who would like to request an accessibility accommodation for an Art Institute program are encouraged to send an e-mail to access@artic.edu two weeks in advance of the program. 

Please note that the image on this page is for reference purposes only and may not be featured during the gallery talk.
